info.name: Dev
info.description:
The **PetAway REST API** provides endpoints for Authorization, as well as *retrieving* Users, Resources, Pets and Walkers. On top of that, it also provides endpoints for *adding* Users and Walkers, as well as *updating* them.

# Getting Started

To start sending requests to the PetAway API, make sure that you have the `Prod` environment selected in Postman.

item.name: Auth

request.description: Used to create an account in our application.
Used to Log In in our application.

item.description: **Authentication** endpoint. This is where you can *Sign Up* and *Log In* to our application.

item.description:
**Users** endpoint. This endpoint is used to manage user-related information.

With this endpoint we can *retrieve* an user information based on their JWT or ID, we can *update* the user profile and change the user password.

item.name: Resource

request.description: Retrieves all the services listed in our database.
Retrieves a certain service by it's ID.

item.description: **Resource** endpoint. Used to *retrieve* the available Services that our application provides.

item.name: Pets

request.description: Used to retrieve a list of all the Pets in our database.
Used to retrieve the information of a Pet, based on it's ID.

item.description: **Pets** endpoint. Used to *retrieve* information about the Pets.

item.name: Walkers

request.description:
Used to create a Walker.

It transforms a User account into a Walker account.
Used to retrieve the information of a given Walker, based on it's ID.

item.description:
**Walkers** endpoint.

With this endpoint we can *create* a Walker, as well as *retrieving* their information.

request.description: Used to retrieve a list of events for a given user.
Used to retrieve a list of events for a given Walker.
Used to change the event status.
